adverbs.description: basically (comparative more basically, superlative most basically)

entries.meaning: In a fundamental, essential or basic manner.
examples: They've added some fancy features, but it's basically still a crappy car.

entries.meaning: Mostly; generally; for the most part.
(filler) Used to refer to the most important or fundamental point the speaker is making; sometimes tending towards a meaningless filler word.
examples: I shouldn't have done it, basically.
To get your eyes tested, you should basically go to the opticians.
Basically, I was born in New York.
